Prerequisites: ADMISSION TO THE BAS IN STRATEGIC LEADERSHIP PROGRAM.
Course Description: THIS COURSE IS DESIGNED TO ENABLE THE STUDENT TO UNDERSTAND AND APPLY THE FUNDAMENTAL CONCEPTS AND PROCEDURES OF BOTH FINANCIAL AND MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTING. TOPICS INCLUDE BASIC ACCOUNTING TERMINOLOGY, FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS AND INTERPRETATION, INTERNAL CONTROL, ETHICAL ISSUES IN ACCOUNTING, COST BEHAVIOR AND COST VOLUME PROFIT ANALYSIS, BUDGETING, AND THE USE OF ACCOUNTING DATA IN MAKING INFORMED, ETHICAL DECISIONS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1. UNDERSTND THE IMPORTANCE & USEFULLNESS OF ACCOUNTING INFO FOR MGRS IN ALL ROLES.
2. UNDERSTAND BASIC ACCT. TEERMINOLOGY.
3. LEARN HOW VARIOUS TRANSACTIONS AFFECT REPORTED FINANCIAL RESULTS.
4. LEARN TO READ, ANALYZE & INTERPRET FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
5. LEARN TO ACCESS & EVALUATE FINANCIAL INFO PUBLISHED ON THE WEB.
Textbook(s): SURVEY OF ACCOUNTING BY EDMONDS, OLDS, MCNAIR & TSAY. 3RD ED.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
